text:
# Best Online California LLC Formation and Maintenance Software

Based on a synthesis of multiple sources, here are the top services for forming and maintaining a California LLC:

## ZenBusiness
**Price:** Free formation plan (pay only state fees) with premium tiers at $39-$299
**Unique Features:**
- Worry-Free Compliance service
- Business dashboard with automated reminders
- Free accounting consultation
- Registered agent service included in higher tiers
- Google Ads credit ($150)

**Website:** [ZenBusiness.com](https://www.zenbusiness.com)

## Incfile
**Price:** $0 + state fees ($119/year after first year)
**Unique Features:**
- Free registered agent service for the first year
- Lifetime company alerts
- Online dashboard for document access
- Free business tax consultation

**Website:** [Incfile.com](https://www.incfile.com)

## Northwest Registered Agent
**Price:** $39-$225 + state fees
**Unique Features:**
- Premium privacy protection
- In-house customer support (no outsourcing)
- One year free registered agent service
- Annual report reminders
- Corporate guides (real support from former lawyers/accountants)

**Website:** [NorthwestRegisteredAgent.com](https://www.northwestregisteredagent.com)

## LegalZoom
**Price:** Starting at $79 + state fees
**Unique Features:**
- Peace of Mind Reviewâ„¢
- Legal forms library access
- Attorney support available
- Extended customer support hours
- 60-day money-back guarantee

**Website:** [LegalZoom.com](https://www.legalzoom.com)

## California-Specific LLC Requirements
- $70 formation fee with the Secretary of State
- $800 annual Franchise Tax Board fee
- Statement of Information (Form LLC-12) filing required every two years ($20 fee)
- Operating Agreement recommended (though not legally required)

## How to Choose
- **Budget-conscious:** ZenBusiness or Incfile (both offer $0 + state fees formation)
- **Premium support:** Northwest Registered Agent
- **Legal service bundle:** LegalZoom

*Note: All services offer formation and registered agent services, but differ in pricing structures, user interfaces, and additional features. Pricing information was consistent across sources, though there was minor variation in the Northwest Registered Agent pricing range.*
